entries.title: Bill and Hillary Clinton made a new offer to give depositions for a House committee’s investigation of Epstein, days ahead of an expected vote on contempt of Congress for the Democratic power couple
A federal judge blocked the Trump administration from revoking immigration protections for hundreds of thousands of Haitians, allowing them to remain in the U.S. legally
The Trump administration is preparing to develop a $12 billion stockpile of critical minerals aimed at helping U.S. manufacturers navigate future supply shortages and overcome reliance on China
Trump demanded Monday that House lawmakers back the bipartisan spending deal passed by the Senate last week and set aside policy demands in an effort to quickly end a partial government shutdown
The Trump administration will provide body cameras to federal officers in Minneapolis, Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem said
The Justice Department released what it says is its final trove of files related to the late Jeffrey Epstein. Here are some takeaways on what we know so far.
The U.S. will reduce tariffs on India to 18%, President Trump said, after the two nations agreed to a trade pact and New Delhi said it would stop buying Russian oil
The January jobs report won’t be released as scheduled Friday because of a partial government shutdown
President Trump says the Kennedy Center will be closed for renovations for two years
Five political stories to watch this week Read more in today’s WSJ Politics Newsletter:
Fearing rising utility costs, job losses and privacy violations, residents have blocked or delayed data-center projects around the country
Five reasons Republicans are worried about this Texas state Senate race
A state-level Democratic win in a region that had voted decisively for President Trump threatens to diminish Republicans’ hopes for the midterm elections
Shifting views on the president’s immigration agenda threaten to turn one of his signature issues into a liability for Republicans in the coming midterm elections
Tulsi Gabbard has been investigating results of the 2020 election that President Trump lost, and earlier this week joined the FBI search of an election center in Georgia
Democratic Sen. Amy Klobuchar of Minnesota announced she will run for state governor after Gov. Tim Walz said earlier this month that he would not seek a third term
U.S. weapons makers are fighting a battle on two fronts: ensuring strong returns for investors and trying to satisfy their biggest customer—the Pentagon
A cloak-and-dagger mystery reminiscent of a John le Carré novel is swirling around a whistleblower complaint that alleges wrongdoing by U.S. spy chief Tulsi Gabbard
The Trump administration approved $15.7 billion of proposed arms sales to Saudi Arabia and Israel, according to the Pentagon
Trump is fast approaching a decision on whether to agree to a Russian proposal to extend limits on long-range nuclear weapons for another year or do nothing when the treaty expires
